elements.title: Marysia Nikitiuk (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the first film written and directed by Marysia Nikitiuk (pictured) has been called one of the "most iconic" works of modern Ukrainian cinema?

elements.title: subgroup distortion theory (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that subgroup distortion theory, introduced by Misha Gromov in 1993, can help encode text?

elements.title: Chip Fletcher (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that according to climate scientist Chip Fletcher, "our communities are scaled and built for a climate that no longer exists"?

elements.title: Cowbridge Girls School (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Cowbridge Girls School, built in 1896, was unusual for its time in providing a science laboratory for the students?

elements.title: Jim Nettles (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Jim Nettles followed his older brother to San Diego State University and the Minnesota Twins, but preceded him in being diagnosed for prostate cancer?

elements.title: Port of Tanjung Kalian (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the current lighthouse at the Port of Tanjung Kalian was built by a Dutch company in 1862 based on a British design?

elements.title: Rakhel Feygenberg (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Rakhel Feygenberg wrote her first novel at age 13, but was forced by her relatives to burn it?

elements.title: Mac enhancer (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Microsoft made a Mac enhancer?
